title: Bug 3666CodeCompletion Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)
description: Bug 3666CodeCompletionHungry code assist (1GDRYW5) jkca (5/15/2001 11:04:56 AM)jresdk 106Under certain circumstances code assist eats too much code.Consider the enclosed class.As a programmer, I must add aparameter to the baz call in bar to make the program correct.Steps:1. UI can decide whether it wants to use the codeassist end position (until the end of current identifier) or the cursor location it used to start with, so as to controlthe amount of source to replace. Removing codeassist option.
OB:
Under certain circumstances, when using code assist, the code is changed to:

baz(x.foo().foo())

instead of

baz(x.foo())

which is incorrect. This behavior causes the program to produce incorrect results or errors.
EB:
Under the described circumstances, when using code assist, the code should be changed to:

baz(x.foo().foo())

instead of

baz(x.foo())

to make the program correct.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Write a class similar to the one provided in the bug report.
2. Invoke code assist on the line containing the 'baz' method call in the 'bar' method.
3. Observe that the code assist eats too much code and inserts an extra method call to 'foo'.
4. The correct behavior should be to only insert the original 'baz(x.foo())' method call.
